input_data.title: Hard Sun
input_data.overview: Two detectives with opposing viewpoints are partnered together five years before the Apocalypse.

response.analytical_summary: Hard Sun is a British crime drama series set in a near-future London facing imminent global destruction. The show explores the moral compromises and desperate actions of two detectives as they navigate a city spiraling into chaos and lawlessness. It blends procedural elements with a bleak, apocalyptic tone, examining themes of redemption, justice, and the fragility of human connection in the face of overwhelming despair. The series offers a tense and morally ambiguous narrative, questioning the value of individual actions when the end is already known.
response.spoiler_rich_plot_summary: The series begins with Detectives Graham Hurley and Eve Talbot investigating a series of crimes in a London gripped by the knowledge that a catastrophic solar event will extinguish all life on Earth in five years. Hurley, a cynical and jaded officer, operates by a strict code of justice, while Talbot is more pragmatic and willing to bend the rules to achieve results. As they investigate various cases, they uncover a complex web of corruption and conspiracy within the police force and the city's elite, who are attempting to secure their own survival amidst the impending doom. The detectives grapple with their own personal demons and past mistakes, finding solace and purpose in their partnership as the world around them descends into anarchy. The series follows their attempts to maintain order and deliver justice, even as the societal structures crumble and the countdown to the apocalypse intensifies, ultimately forcing them to confront difficult choices about their own morality and the legacy they will leave behind.
response.keyword_sentence: Hard Sun is a bleak and suspenseful crime drama set in a near-future London, exploring themes of justice and redemption amidst the backdrop of a looming apocalypse and pervasive corruption.
